intro: Pappobolus sanchezii, commonly known as the Sanche's pappobolus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves and a central flowering stem. Pappobolus sanchezii is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
